Definition: In this task, you're given a text. If the text is about a person, indicate your answer as "Yes". Otherwise, indicate your answer as "No".

Positive Examples.input: Text:  The third and current HMS Argyll is a Type 23 'Duke' Class frigate. She is currently the oldest serving Type 23 frigate in the Royal Navy. Like all of her class she is named for a British dukedom in this case that of Argyll.
Positive Examples.explanation: HMS Argyll is a frigate which a warship. Clearly the text is not about a person. Hence, the answer is No.

Positive Examples.input: Text: Alison Bechdel (/ˈbɛkdəl/ BEK-dəl; born September 10 1960) is an American cartoonist. Originally best known for the long-running comic strip Dykes to Watch Out For she came to critical and commercial success in 2006 with her graphic memoir Fun Home.
Positive Examples.explanation: Alison Bechdel is an American cartoonist. Clearly the text is about a person. The answer should be Yes.

Negative Examples.input: Text:  The third and current HMS Argyll is a Type 23 'Duke' Class frigate. She is currently the oldest serving Type 23 frigate in the Royal Navy. Like all of her class she is named for a British dukedom in this case that of Argyll.
Negative Examples.explanation: HMS Argyll is a frigate which a warship. Clearly the text is not about a person. Hence, it is an incorrect answer and a negative example.

Negative Examples.input: Text: Alison Bechdel (/ˈbɛkdəl/ BEK-dəl; born September 10 1960) is an American cartoonist. Originally best known for the long-running comic strip Dykes to Watch Out For she came to critical and commercial success in 2006 with her graphic memoir Fun Home.
Negative Examples.explanation: The output is neither "Yes" nor "No". Hence, it is an incorrect answer and a negative example.

Instances.input: Text:  An Post (Irish pronunciation: [ən̪ˠ pˠɔsˠt̪ˠ]; English literal translation: Post) is the state-owned provider of postal services in Republic of Ireland. An Post provides a universal postal service to all parts of the country as a member of the Universal Postal Union. Services provided include letter post parcel service deposit accounts Swiftpost an all-Ireland next-day delivery service and EMS the international express-mail service.

Text:  Chattanooga State Community College also known as Chattanooga State is a public comprehensive community college located in Chattanooga Tennessee. The college is a member of the Tennessee Board of Regents System and is accredited by the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools (SACS). Athletically Chattanooga State is a member of Region VII of the NJCAA.

Text:  Boyalıtepe (formerly Gameni or Kamani) is a village in the central district (Karaman) of Karaman Province Turkey. It is situated to the east of Karadağ an excint volcano. Its distance to Karaman is 39 kilometres (24 mi). The population of the village was 321 as of 2011. The village was founded in the 18th century by Bekdik tribe of Turkmens who had migrated from Kaman. The former name Gamani may refer to Kaman. Initially it was a neighbourhood of a nearby village.

Text:  Miłogoszcz [miˈwɔɡɔʂt͡ʂ] is a village in the administrative district of Gmina Tuczno within Wałcz County West Pomeranian Voivodeship in north-western Poland. It lies approximately 6 kilometres (4 mi) south-east of Tuczno 22 km (14 mi) south-west of Wałcz and 112 km (70 mi) east of the regional capital Szczecin.Before 1772 the area was part of Kingdom of Poland 1772-1945 Prussia and Germany. For more on its history see Wałcz County.The village has a population of 120.

Text:  Dimitar Nenov (Bulgarian: Димитър Ненов; December 19 1901 in Razgrad – August 30 1953 in Sofia) was a Bulgarian classical pianist composer music pedagogue and architect. He studied music and architecture in Dresden; he also studied with the noted pianist Egon Petri (himself a student of Ferruccio Busoni).
Text:  The Albești River is a river in Romania tributary of the Black Sea Lake Mangalia.

Text:  John Parry-Gordon (born 17 February 1945 in Ince district — died 3 November 2009(2009-11-03) (aged 64) in Wigan) was an English professional rugby league footballer of the 1960s '70s and '80s playing at representative level for England and Lancashire and at club level for Warrington as a Scrum-half/Halfback i.e. number 7.

Text:  Madhukeshwar Desai (born 25 August 1987) is a BJP politician from Gujarat India. In 2013 he was appointed as the National Vice President of the Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha the youth wing of the Bharatiya Janata Party. At 25 he is the youngest Vice President in the history of the party. He is the great grandson of former Prime Minister of India Morarji Desai.
